sub_title: LLM Graduate in International Migration and Refugee Law
summary:
I graduated in May 2017 from Fordham University with a degree in social work and International Humanitarian Affairs on a pre-law track. I have experience working in a variety of non-profits and agencies, as well as extra-curricular experience, all of which have furthered my passion for human rights and law. I obtained my Master's in Law in International Migration and Refugee Law; my focus is on the relationship between social issues and law.
I am currently seeking employment.

education.field_of_study: Social Work; International Humanitarian Affairs on a Pre-Law Track

awards.title: Fordham University at Lincoln Center: Dean's List
awards.description: I was a part of the Dean's List, representing a GPA level of 3.7 or higher, for 6 semesters of my Bachelor's degree.

awards.title: Phi Alpha National Social Work Honor Society & Social Work Research Candidate
Joan M. Pease Scholarship for Political Science, Journalism or Pre-Law

profile_positions.description:
- Collaborated with a small group of LLM students on legal research and advice.
- Wrote high quality legal opinions to external parties practicing lawyers and non-governmental organizations.
- Completed two projects: an expert legal opinion on the conformity of the Family Reunification Directive and national Dutch law; a third-party intervention submitted to the European Court to Human Rights in the case of S.S. v Sweden.
profile_positions.title: Migration Law Clinic Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
- Interned within the South Bronx Asthma Prevention department focusing on community engagement and involvement in order to prevent emergency department visits for asthma.
- Assisted in running the Successfully Transitioning Youth to Adolescence (STYA) group for local middle school students focusing on healthy lifestyle choices and creativity with the long-term goal of self-esteem building and pregnancy prevention.
- Sat on the committee for and helped with the planning of Denim Day New York City 2017, an event on raising awareness for sexual violence. I assisted as well with other community events and fundraisers preceding the event.
- Created tabling events surrounding public health issues with the goal of engaging the hospital community and providing information in a creative and communicative manner.
profile_positions.title: Department of Pediatrics Intern

company.name: St. Rita's Center for Immigrants and Refugees

profile_positions.company: St. Rita's Center for Immigrants and Refugees
profile_positions.description:
- Engaged with clients in civics classes, English as a Second Language courses, and test preparation for civics exams through the USCIS, as well as other daily necessities.
- Helped develop a website for the organization and coordinated student volunteers for the organization.
- Provided grant writing and grant research for the organization.
profile_positions.title: General Office Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- Assisted projects including: engagement and outreach to lessen HIV stigma, campaigning around the rights of incarcerated transgender individuals, Pride parade preparations for 10+ events, and expanding presence in the Philadelphia area.
- Co-planned a multi-media event project discussing ballroom culture in New York City post-Paris is Burning.
- Conducted and presented research on 15+ topics, consisting of 8-20 page reports, for panels, conferences, and meetings.
profile_positions.title: Community Education Intern

volunteer_experiences.role: Global Outreach: Co President, Executive Board Member
volunteer_experiences.description:
I served on the Executive Board for one year prior to being co-president of Global Outreach.
- The board I was co-president of managed and oversaw fifteen or more events per year for Global Outreach including raising awareness for a variety of social justice issues, and working to engage the larger Fordham community with GO!.
- Organized events and service immersion projects, and helped with the structuring of the teams through the lens of non-paternalistic service and engagement. 
- Worked with administrators, faculty members, and students to produce ten+ projects/year, both domestic and international.

volunteer_experiences.role: Dorothy Day Center for Service and Social Justice: Social Justice Leader
volunteer_experiences.description:
- Communicated opportunities offered by the Dorothy Day Center, collaborated in creating inventive and unique events and dialogues surrounding social justice as a member of Social Justice Programming.
- Designed and circulated informational brochures, posters, and flyers for organizational events.
- Coordinated weekly campaigns with departments and clubs on campus to promote social justice initiatives and awareness.
- Facilitated and directed Fordham University’s program “Urban Plunge” which discusses social justice issues and includes community service outreach in New York City.
- Established cultural visits and volunteer sites for incoming students that explored direct action and social change.
